subject: Re: [junit] problems installing junit
msgSnippet: ... Do you mean that the CLASSPATH varibable includes the value %CLASSPATH%? Infinite loop. Not good. ... 1. Do not use environment variables. Pass the class
messageBody:
paddyangels wrote:

> Hi There,
>
> I have managed to install junit. I have entered my classpath as %
> classpath%;c:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;.

Do you mean that the CLASSPATH varibable includes the value %CLASSPATH%?
Infinite loop. Not good.

> java junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
>
> The Junit gui is loaded fine but I get the following message at the
> bottom of the screen :
>
> Class not found "junit.samples.AllTest". I have looked on forums and
> they say the class path is wrong but I have looked the faq
> instructions and It seems that I have it right. So I am very
> confused. Please could anyone help

1. Do not use environment variables. Pass the class path to the java
interpreter using the -classpath switch.

2. AllTests is not in the .jar file; it's in the JUnit install
directory, so your class path should be

c:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;c:\junit3.8.1

Try that then...

java -classpath c:\junit3.8.1\junit.jar;c:\junit3.8.1
junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
